3e53551e-c6cd-480b-a6ac-df61812b718e: An arcane trickster can use {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} at a range of 30 feet. Working at a distance increases the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} by 5.
c1cfc3ec-4949-4637-b423-4a4cf8bf6f2e: At 10th level, an arcane trickster can add her sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that deals damage, if the targets are {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}. This additional damage only applies to spells that deal hit point damage, and the additional damage is of the same type as the spell. If the spell allows a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to negate or halve the damage, it also negates or halves the sneak attack damage.
bf9c1e4a-5753-4705-9617-1a54ac291dfc: At 1st level, an arcane trickster selects an arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class she belonged to before adding the prestige class. When a new arcane trickster level is gained, the character gains new spells per day and new spells known as if she had also gained a level in that spellcasting class.
cff8619b-9cf2-4b2f-a970-d607e088f56e: At 9th level, an arcane trickster can become invisible, as if under the effects of greater invisibility, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. She can remain invisible for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to her arcane trickster level. Her {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for this effect is equal to her caster level. These rounds need not be consecutive.
14894d66-d51c-4499-af0c-6db037a5b2a6: Beginning at 3rd level, an arcane trickster can enter a special stance that allows him to improvise a way to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} targets regardless of their awareness. An arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per day. For every two levels beyond 3rd, an arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one additional round, up to a maximum of 4 rounds at 9th level. The target of impromptu sneak attacks loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, but only against those attacks. The power can be used against any target, but creatures that are not subject to sneak attacks take no extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (though they still lose any Dexterity bonus to AC against the attack).
fe501c24-e394-4315-98ed-e1b523c7c23e: Beginning at 3rd level, an arcane trickster can enter a special stance that allows him to improvise a way to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} targets regardless of their awareness. An arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per day. For every two levels beyond 3rd, an arcane trickster can maintain this stance for one additional round, up to a maximum of 4 rounds at 9th level. The target of impromptu sneak attacks loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, but only against those attacks. This power can be used against any target, but creatures that are not subject to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} take no extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (though they still lose any Dexterity bonus to AC against the attack).
be59161d-6110-4abe-8a39-3c3c06d158c3: Starting at 5th level, an arcane trickster can cast her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} without their somatic or verbal components, as if using the Still Spell and Silent Spell {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. Spells cast using this ability do not increase in spell level or {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g}. She can use this ability 3 times per day at 5th level and one additional time per every two levels thereafter, to a maximum of 5 times per day at 9th level. The arcane trickster decides to use this ability at the time of casting.
51ebbb15-338d-4638-90cf-bf136523e95c: With their mastery of magic, arcane tricksters can make for even more subtle or confounding opponents than standard rogues. Ranged legerdemain enhances their skill as thieves, and their ability to make sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} without {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} or as part of a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} can make arcane tricksters formidable {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}-dealers.
